title: Notting Hill Carnival announces first ever digital line-up
description: For the first time in 54 years the celebrations are being held online due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Beirut blast: Born without a father
description: Two weeks after the explosion that shattered Beirut, we meet families whose lives changed forever.

title: Coronavirus: Romance scams, the Yahoo boys and my friend Beth
description: Security experts warn there's been an increase in online fraud during the coronavirus pandemic

title: Death Valley: What life is like in the 'hottest place on Earth'
description: The Death Valley just saw one of the highest temperatures ever recorded on Earth - 130F (54.4C)

title: How a hologram can show a patient’s heart during surgery
description: A hologram that shows a patient’s heart in real-time during surgery could help improve accuracy when treating arrhythmias.

title: Ocean-sieving expedition reveals huge amounts of microplastic in the Atlantic
description: The expedition found that as much as 21 million tonnes of plastic fragments are suspended in the ocean.

title: Kamala Harris speech: Women who paved way for first black female VP hopeful
description: The women who paved the way for Kamala Harris' historic run reflect on their own pioneering candidacies.

title: Highlights: Ten-man Linfield fall to late Legia goal in Poland
description: Linfield are out of the Champions League after Jose Kante gives Legia Warsaw a 1-0 win in Tuesday night's first round qualifier.

title: US election 2020: What young Democrats think of Joe Biden
description: He's half a century older than them, but it's his moderate politics that worries these young voters.

title: Motorbike handlebar wheelie world speed record broken by 1mph
description: Stunt driver Jonny Davies got his bike up to 109.2mph - beating the world record by 1mph.

title: Auctioneers see surge in Covid-19 bankruptcy sales
description: Auction firm reports "busiest month in 52 years" as stock is sold from businesses going bankrupt.

title: A-levels: How did Gavin Williamson survive exams U-turn?
description: The education secretary has kept his job but still faces questions about his handling of exam grades, writes Iain Watson.

title: Keeper Hart joins Spurs on free transfer
description: Former Burnley and Manchester City goalkeeper Joe Hart signs for Tottenham on a two-year contract.

title: Jakobsen 'glad to be alive' after crash, but set for 'several facial surgeries'
description: Fabio Jakobsen will require "multiple facial surgeries" after his crash at the Tour of Poland, but says he is "glad to be alive".

title: Rio Ferdinand given six-month driving ban for speeding
description: The former England footballer admits driving at 85mph in Hove, East Sussex, in July last year.

title: Bestival death: Ceon Broughton manslaughter conviction overturned
description: Ceon Broughton was jailed following the death of his girlfriend, the daughter of a Holby City actor.

title: A-levels: Gavin Williamson 'incredibly sorry' for exam distress
description: The education secretary repeatedly refuses to say if he will resign following a U-turn on Monday.

title: Salmond inquiry: Civil servant says investigating complaints 'right thing to do'
description: Scotland's top civil servant says she had a duty to examine allegations against the former first minister.

title: New public health body 'vigilant for viral threat'
description: Matt Hancock says creating a new public health agency will make the country safer.

title: Coronavirus: Cases rise at Newark Bakkavor dessert factory
description: Bakkavor, which makes desserts for Waitrose and Tesco, is testing its whole workforce.

title: Democratic convention: Michelle Obama blasts Trump
description: "Donald Trump is the wrong president for our country," says the ex-first lady in an emotional message.

title: Ligue 1 opener off after Marseille Covid-19 cases
description: The opening match of the French top-flight season is postponed after four positive tests for coronavirus at Marseille.

title: Exam results: How will universities cope with extra students? And other questions
description: Are you concerned about your results? Experts answer some of your questions.

title: Depression doubles during coronavirus pandemic
description: Figures suggest one in five adults in Britain are experiencing depressive symptoms.

title: M&S to cut 7,000 jobs over next three months
description: The High Street retailer says the coronavirus pandemic has meant a "material shift in trade".

title: MPs call for non-league fans to return or risk losing clubs 'forever'
description: MPs have written to sports minister Nigel Huddleston warning non-league clubs "could be lost forever" if fans are not allowed back into grounds.

title: Lego hand comes out of boy's nose after two years
description: Samir Anwar was eating a muffin on a day out when he sneezed the 10 mm piece out of his nose.

title: Black Met Police inspector 'racially harassed' by officers
description: A serving inspector is suing the Met Police for racial harassment after being stopped in his car.

title: Wuhan coronavirus: From silent streets to packed pools
description: Images of crowds at a waterpark festival show how far the city has moved on from its January lockdown.

title: Highland polar bear Hamish to leave Scotland
description: Hamish, the first polar bear to be born in the UK in 25 years, is to be moved to a park in Yorkshire

title: Coronavirus: The County Tyrone hay bale superheroes
description: Wonder Woman, Spiderman and Batman are among the masked crusaders attracting visitors.

title: Fountainstown Beach: Bioluminescent plankton light up Cork beach
description: Bioluminescent plankton light up the waves at Fountainstown Beach, just south of Cork City.

title: England v Pakistan: How do you solve a problem like bad light?
description: Brighter floodlights? New playing times? Financial penalties? BBC pundits attempt to solve one of cricket's oldest issues.

title: Newspaper headlines: Exams U-turn after 'Williamson caves in'
description: Tuesday's front pages are dominated by the government's "humiliating climbdown" on A-level results.

title: Dillian Whyte's boxing column: Howling like a werewolf, growing up in Jamaica & a cook-off against Eddie Hearn
description: In Dillian Whyte's first column for BBC Sport, he talks about growing up in Jamaica, racism, his cook-off against Eddie Hearn and why he howls like a werewolf.

title: Housing crisis: Fighting to survive the property boom
description: Manchester has become one of the fastest developing cities in Europe, but despite a property boom, some locals feel they are losing out.

title: Newsbeat has been investigating how social media is being used to sell drugs
description: Police say social media bosses would do more if it was their children dying from drugs bought this way.
